intro: Myriocladus affinis, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant has adapted to harsh environments through features such as succulent leaves and a deep root system for water retention. Its flowers are typically visited by various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The plant produces capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, facilitating wind dispersal.
